ext_weather.name: Today
ext_weather.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 59. West wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

space_weather:
Space Weather Message Code: ALTTP2
Serial Number: 1120
Issue Time: 2022 Mar 20 0855 UTC

ALERT: Type II Radio Emission
Begin Time: 2022 Mar 20 0743 UTC
Estimated Velocity: 188 km/s

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Description: Type II emissions occur in association with eruptions on the sun and typically indicate a coronal mass ejection is associated with a flare event.

Space Weather Message Code: SUM10R
Serial Number: 726
Issue Time: 2022 Mar 20 0741 UTC

SUMMARY: 10cm Radio Burst
Begin Time: 2022 Mar 20 0549 UTC
Maximum Time: 2022 Mar 20 0553 UTC
End Time: 2022 Mar 20 0602 UTC
Duration: 13 minutes
Peak Flux: 330 sfu
Latest Penticton Noon Flux: 94 sfu

Comment: Radio burst data is provided by the Air Force.

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Description: A 10cm radio burst indicates that the electromagnetic burst associated with a solar flare at the 10cm wavelength was double or greater than the initial 10cm radio background. This can be indicative of significant radio noise in association with a solar flare. This noise is generally short-lived but can cause interference for sensitive receivers including radar, GPS, and satellite communications.

Space Weather Message Code: WARK04
Serial Number: 4055
Issue Time: 2022 Mar 20 0351 UTC

WARNING: Geomagnetic K-index of 4 expected
Valid From: 2022 Mar 20 0350 UTC
Valid To: 2022 Mar 20 1800 UTC
Warning Condition: Onset

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Potential Impacts: Area of impact primarily poleward of 65 degrees Geomagnetic Latitude.
Induced Currents - Weak power grid fluctuations can occur.
Aurora - Aurora may be visible at high latitudes such as Canada and Alaska.
